data.prayer: Father, we pray for every movement leader and disciple in the county of Erode, Tamil Nadu, India that they would have deepening intimacy with you.
data.verse: On that day you will realize that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Erode, Tamil Nadu, India

data.prayer: Father, guide the church in Erode, Tamil Nadu, India to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

data.prayer: Father, encourage your church in Erode that you never forsake them.
data.verse: Those who know your name will put their trust in you, for you, Yahweh, have not forsaken those who seek you.

data.prayer: Father, make bold the prophets in Erode, Tamil Nadu, India so that the church can be equipped with truth and insight and a vision of your heart.
data.verse: These are the things which you should do: speak the truth to one another; judge with truth and judgment for peace in your gates.

data.prayer: Lord, bring the blind by a way that they don’t know. Lead the Amma Kodaga people in paths that they don’t know. Make darkness light before them and crooked places straight. Do not forsake the Amma Kodaga people.
Spirit, fill the 24,769 believers in the county of Erode with tears, because God is not obeyed by those around them.
data.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, for your law is not obeyed.

data.prayer: Spirit, awaken a burning desire for your presence and intimacy among the 2,251,700 people living in the county of Erode.
Jesus, for those distressed and afraid in Erode, Tamil Nadu, India, show them today that you give peace at all times and in every situation.
data.verse: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways. The Lord be with you all.

location.name: Erode
location.people_groups_list: Vallan, Ambalavasi Kambalattu, Eravallan, Valan, Bazigar (Hindu traditions)
